intro: Conceveiba tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly Conceveiba, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and plant collectors.
